chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dustin Cory Shaw was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3,200.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT 
---------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
---------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw appeared by video from Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Dustin Cory Shaw.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing as to both file - 22CF373 & 22CM358 - **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**.

Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw in court, in custody via video from DCI.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Dustin Cory Shaw.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer and discovery received. Defendant is accepting offer. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Dustin Cory Shaw.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Speedy trial rights reserved. Set up video for next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw appeared by video.  Attorney Chris Kuehn on behalf of Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for Dustin Cory Shaw. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing.  Court ordered defendant bound over.  Defendant should be transferred to Dodge; court to set up video with DCI.
Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

8:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw in court, in custody by video. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared. SPD still trying to appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:38 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw appeared by video. Attorney Josh Ryan in court for the deft. 
Atty Ryan states SPD is still trying to appoint. 
AIA set for 8/5 @ 1:15pm, 2464. 
No victims.

Defendant Dustin Cory Shaw appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 1:56 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on both files - 22CF373 and 22CM358. Court addresses defendant as to right to attorney and sets matters over for him to contact SPD's office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant must comply with any IID order. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 1:43 PM. Samuel Berg for the State. Attorney Hagerman for defendant. Record by the State as to bond. Response by Attorney Hagerman, who asks for lower amount of cash. Does not know if defendant qualifies for SPD. $5000 cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
